statement:
Let $\Omega$ be a domain in $\mathbb{C}$ and suppose $f$ is an analytic
function on $\Omega$. Furthermore, let $C$ be a circle inside $\Omega$
with center $z_0$ and radius $r$. Then $f(z_0)$ is the mean value of $f$
along $C$, that is,
$$f(z_0)=\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_0^{2\pi}f(z_0+re^{i\theta})d\theta.$$
